com.fluidops.ajax

Class XMLBuilder.Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.XMLBuilder.Element
  • Enclosing class:
    XMLBuilder

    public static class XMLBuilder.Element
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an element.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      XMLBuilder.Element add(java.lang.String name, XMLBuilder.Attribute... attrib)
      Adds the child with given name and attrs, returns the parent.
      void addAttribute(XMLBuilder.Attribute a)
      if a is null, nothing gets added
      XMLBuilder.Element addChild(XMLBuilder.Element el)
      Adds the given child, returns the parent.
      XMLBuilder.Element aHref(java.lang.String url, java.lang.String label) 
      XMLBuilder.Element appendChild(XMLBuilder.Element el)
      Appends a child element and returns the child.
      java.lang.String closeTag()
      Returns the element's close tag text or the empty string if element is text-node
      XMLBuilder.Element el(java.lang.String name, XMLBuilder.Attribute... attrib)
      Appends the child with given names and attributes, returns the child.
      java.util.List<XMLBuilder.Attribute> getAttributes() 
      XMLBuilder.Element getChild(java.lang.String name, int idx)
      Returns the idx-th child with the given name.
      java.util.List<XMLBuilder.Element> getChildren() 
      java.util.List<XMLBuilder.Element> getChildren(java.lang.String name, boolean recurse)
      Returns all children with the given name.
      java.util.List<XMLBuilder.Element> getDescendants(java.lang.String name)
      Returns all descendants with given name.
      java.lang.String getName() 
      XMLBuilder.Element getParent() 
      java.lang.String getValue() 
      java.lang.String openTag()
      Returns the element's open tag text or the empty string if element is text-node
      java.lang.String renderChildrenFlat()
      Returns all children in a flat hierarchie.
      XMLBuilder.Element select(java.lang.String path)
      Selects the element with the given XPath-like path.

      Adds the given text, returns the parent.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Creates the string representation.
      void toString(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
      Creates the string representation.
      java.lang.String toStringFormatted()
      Returns the XML Tree formatted as a tree, delimiter for tabs is " "
      java.lang.String toStringFormatted(java.lang.String delimChar)
      Returns the XML Tree formatted as a tree, delimiter is specified in delimChar Examples for delimChar: " ", "\t", " " Except for the delimiter "\t", the delimChar is repeated 4 times
      XMLBuilder.Element up()
      Short form of parent.
      XMLBuilder.Element up(int n)
      Returns the n-th parent.

      • select

        public XMLBuilder.Element select(java.lang.String path)
        Selects the element with the given XPath-like path. This is no real XPath, as it only addresses *single* elements. Selection on element sets is TODO. Examples: "/child/anotherchild[2]/text()[1]" "../child[2]/anotherchild[3]"
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:

      • toStringFormatted

        public java.lang.String toStringFormatted(java.lang.String delimChar)
        Returns the XML Tree formatted as a tree, delimiter is specified in delimChar Examples for delimChar: " ", "\t", " " Except for the delimiter "\t", the delimChar is repeated 4 times
